column5: Been having fun the last week or so, teasing a few musky from the last of the weeds here on Wabigoon Lake.
Gorgeous trophies. Those bites by the boat... totally exciting.
NICE Simon !
Real nice
NICE !
Right? That is the coolest and most heart stopping thing when it happens. Thanks Wayne!! Thanks Terry!
Awesome videos and some very respectable catches.   Thanks for sharing
Amazing! Is the water always that colour? Looks kinda muddy/murky

Yes, Wabigoon Lake looks like a Timmies double/double all year. The whole area is mostly clay. The fish are also very pale, low light penetration, kind of the same effect as those albino salamanders that live in caves, lol, no need for any pigment. It’s all vibration and scent for fishing. Got a couple more yesterday evening too, definitely holds lots of fish despite the water clarity. Walleye, perch, pike, crappie, bass and musky, lots to choose from. I’ve even caught the odd whitefish and eel pout too, very productive but also challenging, good fun.  Yesterday’s musky……(and a decent pike)
Thanks Rich, not world records for sure, but fun as heck anyway.
love the beautiful pale colour of those musky!
How's the topwater bite for them?

I just got back last week-end from two weeks on the North Channel of the French River.  All I have to show for it was one lazy follow the first day.  Of course the weather was not the best for me.   Still happy to see other anglers having fun and success.    Videos like this - keep the rest of us pumped.   Thanks again

Kind of 'iffy' on the topwater, which is a shame because nothing beats that sudden explosion. Mostly bucktails buzzed over the weeds, with the odd spinnerbait (when the weed is really thick) or a boilermaker. Its weird because I can buzz all of those lures over the tops of cabbage which in effect is 'topwater' , but throw an actual topwater on and there seems to be little to no interest whatsoever.
Had plenty of those days too....just makes for a pretty boring video, so you don't see them.....lol.
Nice, you are in god's country when it comes to freshwater fishing. If I could make a good living I would be there too !
I make a pittance compared to what I could make in a city, but “good living” is more than money for me, I’m happy here, poor…. Lol… but rich in other ways.
Those are some nice musky Simon Thanks for sharing enjoyed that w coffee this am Cheers Andrew
man i just drove right by that lake last week with my kayak ontop of the truck guess i should have stopped over for a Day! nice fish and  great video's
Amen to that !!
awesome.yes life is more then money.your happy thats what matters.
I was waiting for the swimming squirrel to get hit.
